pageProps.title: Books
pageProps.content:
These are the books which I highly recommend for software engineers.

### On development

#### 1. [Code complete →](https://www.amazon.com/Code-Complete-Practical-Handbook-Construction/dp/0735619670)

Approaches to use for software construction.

#### 2. [Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture →](https://www.amazon.com/Patterns-Enterprise-Application-Architecture-Martin/dp/0321127420)

How to organize business logic in your application.

#### 3. [Refactoring →](https://www.amazon.com/Refactoring-Improving-Existing-Addison-Wesley-Signature-ebook/dp/B07LCM8RG2)

Code smells and refactoring techniques. Requires practice during reading.

#### 4. [Unit Testing Principles, Practices, and Patterns →](https://www.amazon.com/Unit-Testing-Principles-Practices-Patterns/dp/1617296279)

How to write code which tests your code.

#### 5. [Microservices Patterns: With examples in Java →](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1617294543)

When and how to develop microservices. Covers essentials of DDD, CQRS, Saga.

### On teamwork

#### 1. [Mythical Man-Month →](https://www.amazon.com/Mythical-Man-Month-Software-Engineering-Anniversary/dp/0201835959)

On costs of people onboarding and communication.

#### 2. [Peopleware →](https://www.amazon.com/Peopleware-Productive-Projects-Tom-DeMarco/dp/0932633439)

Why people are more important for successful projects than technology.

#### 3. [Goldratt's Theory of Constraints →](https://www.amazon.com/Goldratts-Theory-Constraints-Continuous-Improvement/dp/0873893700)

Identify a bottleneck and don't waste limited resources.

#### 4. [Elastic Leadership →](https://www.amazon.com/Elastic-Leadership-Growing-self-organizing-teams/dp/1617293083)

Three levels of team maturity and how to grow your team.
